items.title: RBI Policy: Rate-sensitive banking, NBFC, auto and realty stocks gain up to 2% after 25 bps repo rate cut
items.summary: Banking, NBFC, auto, and realty stocks saw gains of up to 2% on Friday following the Reserve Bank of India's 25 basis point repo rate cut. This move, aligning with expectations, was driven by record-low retail inflation and a stable price outlook, aiming to bolster economic growth.

items.title: Are trillion-dollar valuations for Nvidia and AI giants built on fairy tale? Aswath Damodaran decodes
items.summary: Valuation guru Aswath Damodaran questions if trillion-dollar market caps, particularly Nvidia's, are driven by genuine performance or investor fantasy. He uses a 'possible, plausible, probable' framework to assess Nvidia's revenue needs and warns of the 'Big Market Delusion' in AI, where aggregate valuations outstrip realistic revenue potential.

items.title: RBI Inflation FY2025-26: MPC slashes inflation aim by 60 bps to 2% as food prices ease
items.summary: RBI Inflation 2025-26: The Reserve Bank of India has lowered its inflation projection for the fiscal year 2025-26 to 2%. This comes as inflationary pressures ease due to GST rate cuts and improved supply conditions. The central bank also significantly raised its GDP growth forecast for the same period to 7.3%, signalling a positive economic outlook.

items.title: Global hedge funds outpace major indexes with 15% returns in 2025
items.summary: Global hedge funds are ending 2025 on a strong footing, delivering nearly 15% returns through November, driven by stock pickers, quant strategies, and a standout rally in healthcare. While long-short equity funds outperformed major U.S. indices, TMT-focused funds lagged due to a tech sell-off. Regionally, managers remained bullish on North America, added exposure to Japan, and pared positions in Europe and Hong Kong.

items.title: Rupee rises 20 paise to 89.69 against US dollar ahead of RBI's monetary policy decision

items.title: RBI GDP Growth 2025: Central bank raises FY26 growth forecast to 7.3%
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has raised India’s GDP growth forecast for FY2025-26 to 7.3%, up from 6.8%, following stronger-than-expected economic performance. In the July–September quarter, GDP grew 8.2%, a six-quarter high driven by robust consumer demand boosted by GST rate cuts. The economy grew 6.5% in FY25.

items.title: RBI MPC cuts repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%, maintains neutral stance; revises GDP, inflation forecast for FY26
items.summary: Latest Monetary Policy Committee meeting updates: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee cut the policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, maintaining a neutral stance. This decision follows a significant drop in inflation to a multi-decade low and robust GDP growth of 8.2% in Q2 FY2026. The move aims to provide monetary support amidst favorable economic conditions.

items.title: RBI MPC Meeting: Key takeaways from RBI’s latest policy
items.summary: RBI MPC Key Takeaways: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the repo rate to 5.25%. This move supports economic growth. The central bank has also upgraded its GDP forecast to 7.3%. Inflation has fallen significantly, providing room for monetary easing. The RBI is taking steps to ensure liquidity in the market. The Indian rupee has shown recovery against the US dollar.

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 5 December 2025: Stock markets rally as RBI cuts interest rate; Sensex jumps 447 points
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty Highlights on 5 December 2025: Stock market benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty rallied on Friday after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut key benchmark interest rate for the first time in six months and took steps to boost liquidity to support a "goldilocks" economy in the face of high US tariffs.

Rising for the second day in a row, the 30-share BSE Sensex advanced 447.05 points, or 0.52 per cent, to settle at 85,712.37. During the day, it jumped 531.4 points, or 0.62 per cent, to 85,796.72.

The 50-share NSE Nifty climbed 152.70 points, or 0.59 per cent, to 26,186.45.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Can any government really keep young teens off social media? All eyes are on Australia
items.summary: Australia expects to protect children with its social media ban that Meta has begun to comply with, but the internet rarely bends to rules. Social media is addictive—and that’s one reason under-16s may seek workarounds, potentially leaving us clueless of the ban’s efficacy.

items.title: Health & national security cess only on demerit goods like pan masala, not essentials, says Nirmala Sitharaman

The collected revenue will create a dedicated fund for health and national security. This move aims to deter consumption of certain products. The bill has received parliamentary approval.

The bank is also considering the export of gold to India, having secured a licence to do so. It's also examining entry into the education and healthcare sectors.

items.title: India, Russia eye trade boost with more diversified basket
items.summary: India and Russia aim to double bilateral trade to $100 billion by 2030, focusing on diversifying exports beyond current levels. Both nations are actively seeking to address the significant trade imbalance, with New Delhi identifying opportunities in consumer goods, automobiles, and electronics. Russia is keen to increase India's share in its imports, offering support for Indian businesses.

items.title: Fitch raises FY26 growth forecast to 7.4% from 6.9%
items.summary: Fitch Ratings has boosted India's economic growth forecast for FY26 to 7.4 percent. This upgrade is driven by robust consumer spending and recent Goods and Services Tax reforms. The agency anticipates the Indian Rupee will strengthen against the dollar. Falling inflation provides room for the Reserve Bank of India to further reduce policy rates.

items.title: To become global reinsurance hub, GIFT City must offer global regularity clarity
items.summary: To be sure, GIFT City already extends several benefits to reinsurers seeking to make this an operational hub. It offers no additional capital injection requirement, a 10-year tax holiday, and significantly lighter staffing and regulatory obligations than onshore India, where full-fledged operations demand a CEO, CFO, chief compliance officer and strict key managerial personnel norms.

items.title: RBI scraps old lending curbs, downplays risk to corporate bond volumes
items.summary: The RBI repealed its 2016 guidelines limiting large borrowers' access to bank loans, and pushing them to borrow from the debt market. This change is expected to enhance corporate borrowing capacity, potentially allowing banks to lend an additional  ₹3-4.5 trillion.

Additional amendments cover credit facilities for jewellers and require more frequent, accurate reporting of credit information from banks and NBFCs to Credit Information Companies, enhancing the quality and timeliness of data used for credit assessment and monitoring.

The ‘C’ grade assigned to national accounts data was due to the outdated 2011-12 base year. India will adopt 2022-23 as the new base year from February 27, 2026, ensuring more accurate GDP and GVA calculations.

items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
